question: 焼く
sourceAnswer: to{} burn | roast/broil/grill/bake/toast/barbecue | heat/heat-up | make-(charcoal,-pottery,-bricks,-etc.)/bake/fire/burn | tan-(i.e.-suntan)/burn | print-(a-photo)/burn-(an-optical-disc) | be-jealous-of/be-envious-of/envy
sourceMnemonic: This word consists of kanji with hiragana attached. Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>bake</kanji> or <kanji>cook</kanji>. So, the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to bake</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to cook</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading comes from the reading you learned with the kanji.
